description: A dashboard for visualizing results from the k6.io load testing tool by groups, using the InfluxDB exporter.Based on https://grafana.com/dashboards/10660

options.content:
### To choose which measurements to show, use the **Measurements** drop-down in the top left corner!

K6 collects metrics for several phases during the HTTP request lifetime.

The combined delays for the application and network (send, wait, recieve) are available in this metric:
  * **http_req_duration**       _( Total time for request, excluding time spent blocked (http_req_blocked), DNS lookup (http_req_looking_up) and TCP connect (http_req_connecting) time. )_

This metric can also be broken down into these metrics:
  * **http_req_tls_handshaking**     _( Time spent handshaking TLS session with remote host. )_
  * **http_req_sending**      _( Time spent sending data to remote host.  )_
  * **http_req_waiting**      _( Time spent waiting for response from remote host (a.k.a. "time to first byte", or "TTFB"). )_
  * **http_req_receiving**       _( Time spent receiving response data from remote host. )_

These metrics measure delays and durations on the client:

  * **http_req_blocked**     _( Time spent blocked (waiting for a free TCP connection slot) before initiating request.  )_
  * **http_req_looking_up**     _( Time spent looking up remote host name in DNS. )_
  * **http_req_connecting**     _( Time spent establishing TCP connection to remote host. )_


### View official K6.io documentation here: [https://docs.k6.io/docs/result-metrics][1]


[1]: https://docs.k6.io/docs/result-metrics

targets.expr: sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="172.19.22.210:9100", mode="system"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="172.19.22.210:9100"}[$__rate_interval])))

sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="172.19.22.210:9100", mode="user"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="172.19.22.210:9100"}[$__rate_interval])))

sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="iowait", instance="172.19.22.210:9100"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="172.19.22.210:9100"}[$__rate_interval])))

sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="172.19.22.210:9100", mode=~".*irq"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="172.19.22.210:9100"}[$__rate_interval])))

sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{ mode!='idle',mode!='user',mode!='system',mode!='iowait',mode!='irq',mode!='softirq', instance="172.19.22.210:9100"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="172.19.22.210:9100"}[$__rate_interval])))

sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="172.19.22.210:9100", mode="idle"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="172.19.22.210:9100"}[$__rate_interval])))

matcher.options: Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

panels.description: Percentage of elapsed time during which I/O requests were issued to the device (bandwidth utilization for the device). Device saturation occurs when this value is close to 100% for devices serving requests serially.  But for devices  serving requests in parallel, such as RAID arrays and modern SSDs, this number does not reflect their performance limits.
panels.title: Time Spent Doing I/Os

sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="172.19.22.91:9100", mode="user"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="172.19.22.91:9100"}[$__rate_interval])))

sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="iowait", instance="172.19.22.91:9100"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="172.19.22.91:9100"}[$__rate_interval])))

sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="172.19.22.91:9100", mode=~".*irq"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="172.19.22.91:9100"}[$__rate_interval])))

sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{ mode!='idle',mode!='user',mode!='system',mode!='iowait',mode!='irq',mode!='softirq', instance="172.19.22.91:9100"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="172.19.22.91:9100"}[$__rate_interval])))

sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="172.19.22.91:9100", mode="idle"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="172.19.22.91:9100"}[$__rate_interval])))

panels.description: Percentage of elapsed time during which I/O requests were issued to the device (bandwidth utilization for the device). Device saturation occurs when this value is close to 100% for devices serving requests serially.  But for devices  serving requests in parallel, such as RAID arrays and modern SSDs, this number does not reflect their performance limits.
panels.title: Time Spent Doing I/Os
Top processes by Total CPU use
Top processes by Total memory used

targets.query: SELECT mean("value") FROM "checks" WHERE $timeFilter AND ("testid" =~ /^$testid$/)  GROUP BY "check", "group"

SELECT max("value")
FROM "vus"
WHERE $timeFilter AND "testid" =~ /^$testid$/
GROUP BY time($__interval)
fill(null)

SELECT sum("value") / ($__interval_ms / 1000)
FROM "http_reqs"
WHERE $timeFilter
GROUP BY time($__interval), "scenario"
fill(null)

SELECT mean("tps")
FROM (
    SELECT count("value") / ($__interval_ms / 1000) AS "tps"
    FROM "group_duration"
    WHERE ("testid" =~ /^$testid$/) AND $timeFilter
    GROUP BY time($__interval), "group", "scenario"
)
WHERE "tps" > 0
GROUP BY time($__interval), "group", "scenario"
fill(null)

SELECT sum("value") FROM "checks" 
WHERE ("group" =~ /^$Group$/)
  AND $timeFilter
GROUP BY time($__interval), s
fill(none)

SELECT sum("value") / ($__interval_ms / 1000)
FROM "http_reqs"
WHERE ("group" =~ /^$Group$/ AND "status" != '200' AND "status" != '302' AND "status" != '301')
  AND $timeFilter
GROUP BY time($__interval), "scenario"
fill(none)
SELECT MEAN("value") FROM "autogen"."group_duration" WHERE ("group" =~ /^$Group$/ AND "scenario" =~ /^$scenario$/ AND "testid" =~ /^$testid$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "scenario", "group"
SELECT status from (SELECT "method", "value" FROM "http_req_duration" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY "name","status" )
SELECT count(*),"status" from (SELECT "method", "value", "status" FROM "http_req_duration" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY "name","status" )

SELECT percentile("value", 95) as PERCENTILE_95, percentile("value", 99) as PERCENTILE_99, max("value") as  max_response_time, mean("value") as  avg_response_time, min("value") as  min_response_time, count("value") as  count    FROM "http_req_duration" WHERE $timeFilter  GROUP BY "name","status","method"  fill(null)
SELECT sum("value") FROM "http_reqs" WHERE ("status" != '200' AND "status" != '201'  AND "status" != '302' ) AND $timeFilter group by status, method, "name"

panels.description: Grouped by 1 sec intervals and group name
panels.title: $Measurement (over time per group)

panels.description: Grouped by 1 sec intervals and group name
panels.title: $Measurement (over time per tag)

targets.query: SELECT MEAN("value") as group_duration  FROM "autogen"."group_duration" WHERE ("group" =~ /^$Group$/ AND "scenario" =~ /^$scenario$/ AND "testid" =~ /^$testid$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "group"

SELECT count("value"), min("value"), median("value"), max("value"), mean("value"), percentile("value", 95) FROM /^$Measurement$/ WHERE ("group" =~ /^$Group$/ AND "name" =~ /^$Tag$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "group"

SELECT count("value"), min("value"), median("value"), max("value"), mean("value"), percentile("value", 95) FROM /^$Measurement$/ WHERE ("group" =~ /^$Group$/ AND "name" =~ /^$Tag$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "name"

SELECT count("value"), min("value"), median("value"), max("value"), mean("value"), percentile("value", 95) FROM /^$Measurement$/ WHERE ("group" =~ /^$Group$/ AND "name" =~ /^$Tag$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "name"
SELECT status from (SELECT "method", "value" FROM /^$Measurement$/ WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY "name","status" )
SELECT count(*),"status" from (SELECT "method", "value", "status" FROM /^$Measurement$/ WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY "name","status" )

SELECT percentile("value", 95) as PERCENTILE_95, percentile("value", 99) as PERCENTILE_99, max("value") as  max_response_time, mean("value") as  avg_response_time, min("value") as  min_response_time, count("value") as  count    FROM /^$Measurement$/ WHERE $timeFilter  GROUP BY "name","status","method"  fill(null)
